item.title: Internet.nl adds test for security.txt
item.description: Test for modern Internet Standards like IPv6, DNSSEC, HTTPS, TLS, HSTS, DMARC, DKIM, SPF, STARTTLS and DANE.
item.author: (Platform Internetstandaarden / Internet Standards Platform)

item.title: Ignite 2022 Showcases Visual Studio for Cloud, Collaborative Development -- Visual Studio Magazine
item.description: The days of a single developer sitting in an office while using desktop Visual Studio to code a monolithic enterprise app are waning. Now it's all about the cloud and collaboration, Microsoft emphasized at the start of its big Ignite 2022 conference.
item.author: (By David Ramel10/12/2022)

item.title: In praise of ffmpeg
item.description: My last “In praise of” article covered qemu, a project founded by Fabrice Bellard, and today I want to take a look at another work by Bellard: ffmpeg. Bellard has a knack for building high-quality software which solves a problem so well that every other solution becomes obsolete shortly thereafter, and ffmpeg is no exception.

item.title: Toyota Accidently Exposed A Secret Key Publicly On GitHub For Five Years
item.description: On October 7th, Toyota revealed a partial copy of their T-Connect source code had been accidentally exposed for 5 years, including access to data for over 290,000 customers.

item.title: No Need to Wait for .NET 8 to Try Experimental WebAssembly Multithreading -- Visual Studio Magazine
item.description: Multithreading support for client-side Blazor WebAssembly apps is planned for .NET 8 in November 2023, but developers can try it out now for .NET apps thanks to experimental functionality in the brand-new .NET 7 Release Candidate 2.
item.author: (By David Ramel10/11/2022)

item.title: Announcing NuGet PackageReference support for C++/CLI MSBuild projects targeting .NET Core and .NET 5 or higher
item.description: One of the new features for C++ developers in Visual Studio 2022 version 17.3 is NuGet PackageReference support for C++/CLI MSBuild projects that target .NET Core and .NET 5 or higher. More specifically, this impacts CLR Class Library (.NET) and CLR Empty Project (.NET) project templates.
item.author: (Augustin Popa)

item.title: Internet.nl adds test for security.txt
item.description: A new security.txt test component has been added to the Internet.nl website test in collaboration with the Digital Trust Center (DTC).
